Although Mr. Belvedere is already pretty deranged.

name: randombeing
text: I'm enjoying this week's run of strips perhaps more than I should. I'm secretly amused half to death by lolcats.com.

name: veck
text: I'm horrified that it's been Achewood that's introduced me to such a thing.

name: equinn2006
text: I am beginning to fear a Beef reprisal here, possibly a dis-invitation to a certain civil union. At least, that's how it's going on in THIS cool cat's brain!

name: projectyl
text:
Why did Ray have Roane Shaughnessy in his autocomplete list? Does he frequently contact Roane with "craaazy shit they oughta put on the damn news"? If so, why is Roane still fairly cordial to Ray here?

Time will tell, unless it doesn't.

name: closefriend
text: Well, Roane is obviously a human and he thinks Ray is one, so they can't know each other that well unless Roane has an Underground VIP pass.

name: equinn2006
text: I feel like the unknown reason Roane and Ray have corresponded previously is the sweet bonus joke atop the larger main joke of the strip. This subtle complexity is what Achewood is all about to me. Who says a comic strip should have one focus?

name: dr_manflesh_desires_anal_play_immediately
text: A comment left by dr_manflesh_desires_anal_play_immediately was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by equinn2006, atticusonline, Wolfslice)

name: featurelessvoid
text: Ray has hell of news producers in his autocomplete list.  A mogul gots to know how to work the press.

name: zeroasalimit
text: You think they don't put Rays ideas of heads been blown off in the news?

name: varnish
text: You'll see Sidney Yamahata again. You see him everytime you turn on the local access news station. It doesn't matter where you are.

name: silver_lake
text: Truer words were never asset-bar'd. Chby.

name: snoozebar
text: I can't help but think LOLAchewood might be the stake in this meme's black, pulsing, adorable heart.

name: lateadopter
text: A comment left by lateadopter was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by silver_lake, equinn2006, gussiejives, JuanCarlos)

name: silver_lake
text: Yeah, if Onstad hadn't written everything they'd copied in the first place.

name: lateadopter
text:
Onstad also wrote the Volvo of Despair, so he's copying his old material, too. What makes these fun is the references to old story arcs where it is actually appropriate to say the cat was in the place doing the thing. (Plus, the involvement of real cartoon cats).

"I'm in your crate, judging your badasses."

name: toughasnails001
text: Let's not start with this. Please.

name: lateadopter
text:
Start what? Several people seem to have thought I was dissing the quality of Onstad's work, when really I was praising some of the stuff other folks have posted here. A clarification was in order.

"I'm in your box, waiting to die with all the other children."

"im in ur dumbwaiter, packin hot lunches"

Sorry.

I feel like I ought to explain.
An ethernet cable is basically a length of Cat 5 cable with two RJ45 connectors.
It is a terrible nerd joke.

Thank you.

name: jujubeesforjesus
text: Here here.  These could be guest strips.

name: jujubeesforjesus
text: Sorry, 'almost' be guest strips.  Needs to be a gosh dang edit on this here forum.

name: straw
text: So I suppose all those brilliant references to Wikipedia and eBay don't count, then?

name: autrepoupee
text: There is a difference between referencing the 'internet' (Wikipedia, eBay) and referencing 'internet culture' (lolcats, other memes).  That being said, I think these strips were both quite funny. I usually hate references for reference-sakes, but this fits in with the Achewood universe pretty squarely. Ya see, theys cats, and theys funny!

name: straw
text: I agree. I think that lolachewood is as relevant as Ray thinking he's jerking around an e-mail con artist.  lolcats mixed with Achewood seems like a natural fit just as Ray thinking he knows his internet.

name: grayfox
text: Referencing memes, especially one with relation to 4chan is basically scraping the bottom of the barrel.  Granted I do loves me some lolcats.

name: neonfreon
text: A comment left by neonfreon was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, equinn2006, dr_sexlove)

name: jujubeesforjesus
text: The issue is not referencing 'the real world' (if lolcats can even be included in that category) but rather the quality of the reference.  Keith Moon's head in a jar?  Weird, unexpected, and clever.  An online comic strip about the latest internet fad?  Obvious, lazy and unclever.  Vive la difference.

text: All night long, Channel 7 receives complaints of its viewers spontaneously and uncontrollably vomiting upon looking into the eyes of the cat with the make-up on.

name: odvo
text: (From Wikipedia) A lolcat is an image macro featuring a photograph of a cat with a humorous and idiosyncratic caption. The name "lolcat" is a compound of lol and cat.[1][2] lolcats are also referred to as cat macros.[3] lolcats are created for photo sharing imageboards and other internet forums, especially on Saturdays ("Caturdays").[4] lolcats are similar to other animal-based image macros such as the O RLY? owl,[5] but the cuteness of cats "enhances"[6] the appeal and increasing prominence[7][8][9] of the Internet meme. lolcats are examples of anthropomorphism. Common graphical themes include cats holding invisible objects.[6]

name: straw
text: I want to know what's so uncute about owls. Is it that they sometimes eat cats?  Does that subtract from the mean cuteness?

name: tetsujin
text: You know, people criticize Wikipedia for bad or unreliable information - but worse still is the bad -writing-.  When a bunch of people get together to collaborate on writing a -single paragraph- it shows - especially when some of the major contributors are verbal slobs.

name: steerpike66
text: This is true in many cases but usually not on authoritative wiki pages about big serious things. The idea that a page about something as ephemeral and futile as lolcats should be meticulously written and researched seems pointless and awful to me, like a glorious epic poem about Rosie O Donnell.

name: darthemed
text: Have you seen the Batman page? It is a featured article.

name: steerpike66
text: Batman is not ephemeral trash; he is one of about five of the most iconic fictional American Noir characters of the 20th century, like Philip Marlowe, and has proven his popularity and durability for 50 years. He is not an lolcat.
